name: Lyda, for use, Appellant, v. Edwards et al.

judges: Before Moschzisker, C. J., Frazer, Simpson, Kephart, Sadler and Schaefer, JJ.
parties: Lyda, for use, Appellant, v. Edwards et al.

opinions.text:
Per Curiam,
This is an appeal from an order striking off a judgment by confession, entered on a warrant contained in a lease to defendants. The facts involved are sufficiently stated in Lyda v. Edwards, 94 Pa. Superior Ct. 273, where they came up on appeal from an order requiring a prior confessed judgment for the full amount of rent now claimed by appellant to be satisfied on the payment of a compromise sum agreed upon by the parties in interest. The written contract of compromise there set forth plainly contemplated the release of all possible rental indebtedness due by the tenant to the landlord, or claimed by the latter; such being the case, the present confession of judgment, — entered after the date of the order of the Superior Court, — was properly stricken off by the court below.
The order appealed from is affirmed at cost of appellant.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: W. M. Ruddock, James W. Mack and Hcurry W. Earhart, for appellee, were not heard.
casebody.head_matter:
Lyda, for use, Appellant, v. Edwards et al.
Argued March 25, 1929.
Before Moschzisker, C. J., Frazer, Simpson, Kephart, Sadler and Schaefer, JJ.
E. Walker Smith, for appellant.
W. M. Ruddock, James W. Mack and Hcurry W. Earhart, for appellee, were not heard.
April 15, 1929:
